titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mitchell Loeb Papers TAM.627
titlestmt.author: Collection processed by Bonnie Gordon

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

address.addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2023-06-13T13:15:59

did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Yiddish.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize box, and 1 flat file.

did.abstract: The collection contains over 200 cartoons, drawings, posters and related clippings reflecting Loeb's support for labor, liberal Democrats and Israel. Most of the work was done in the mid-1930s for the Jewish Daily Forward and International Ladies Garment Workers Union.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.175.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by material type.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mitchell Loeb (1889-1968) was an artist and cartoonist whose work reflected his support for labor, liberal Democrats, and Isael. Loeb was born in Poland and came to the United States as a teenager. For a short period after World War I, Loeb was an artist for The Jewish Daily Forward and The Jewish Day. After, he ran a commercial art studio in New York City.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Mitchell Loeb Papers; TAM 627; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Mitchell Loeb Papers (TAM 627) was previously named the Mitchell Loeb Drawings (TAM 065) and then the Mitchell Loeb Photographs (PHOTOS 169). Materials were arranged and described by the archivist.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Tamiment/Wagner Poster Collection (GRAPHICS 002) includes several posters produced by Mitchell Loeb; works produced by Loeb can be found in the Eugene V. Debs Papers (TAM 020) as well. Other items produced by Mitchell Loeb are also held by the Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives at Cornell University in its International Ladies Garment Workers (ILGWU) Paintings, Photographs, and Memorabilia collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Mitchell Loeb Papers consist of 223 items total, covering a number of different meda. It includes 35 posters, 141 drawings, seven graphic items, nine pamphlets, 23 black and white photographs, three 8x10 negatives and five newspaper clippings. Dated items range from the mid 1930s to the mid 1950s and consist mainly of work done by Loeb himself for the International Ladies Garment Workers Union (ILGWU) and the Jewish Daily Forward newspaper.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1927-1954, are expected to enter the public domain in 2074.
